snippet: A Siberian tiger released into the wild in Russia in the spring crossed a river this week into China, where wildlife officials are tracking his whereabouts.
abstract: Kuzya, Siberian tiger that Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin helped reintroduce into the wild, crosses Amur River into China; wildlife officials in China’s far northeast are scrambling to ascertain tiger’s whereabouts after his Russian minders, tracking him by radio transmitter, expressed concern that he could end up in the hands of poachers.

byline.contributor: Kiki Zhao and Bree Feng contributed research from Beijing, and Nikolay Khalip from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: A Siberian tiger released into the wild in Russia in the spring crossed a river this week into China, where wildlife officials are tracking his whereabouts.

headline.main: ‘Putin’s Tiger,’ in a Territory Grab All His Own, Swims to China
headline.print_headline: Putin’s Tiger,’ in a Territory Grab All His Own, Swims to China
